intro: Turnera serrata var. serrata, commonly known as the serrated turnera, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Passifloraceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually ovate with serrated edges, contributing to its common name. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments.
